The looming threat of renewed quota agitation by Jats in Haryana was averted on Friday with the community leaders announcing that no protest will be held till April 3 if the State government gets the reservation Bill passed in the Assembly during the ongoing session that ends on March 31.

The announcement was made by All India Jat Aarakshan Sangharsh Samiti President Yashpal Malik here after talks with Haryana Chief Secretary D S Dhesi and DGP Yashpal Singhal.

“We have given time to Haryana government to bring and pass the Jat reservation Bill by March 31 (when the ongoing Budget session ends),” Mr Malik told reporters here.

“If the government does not pass the reservation Bill by March 31, then we shall chalk out our next course of action in our meeting on April 3 to be held in Delhi.”

Replying to questions, he said “there will be no strike or agitation before April 3... I appeal to other brethren of the community also not to take any decision about agitation or strike in the State till April 3.” -- PTI
title: Jat agitation put off till April 3
